screen_desc: The screenshot displays a settings menu on a smartphone. Key sections include "Location," where access is granted to 4 apps, "Security" for screen lock and fingerprint settings, "Accounts" related to Google, "Accessibility" for features like screen readers and interaction controls, and "Google" for services and preferences. The status bar shows the time and various system icons. The navigation buttons are located at the bottom of the screen.
history_actions: click on the Settings icon located at the upper left.

think.Thought: The user wants to change the appearance of the keyboard, which is typically controlled through the 'Languages & input' or 'System' settings. Since the current screen displays a general settings menu without those specific options, I will need to locate the appropriate section for keyboard settings. The most likely path to access this would be through the 'System' section at the bottom of the screen. I will first open the 'System' section and look for 'Languages & input' or any related keyboard settings.
Future Action Plan: Click on 'System' to open the next settings section.
